channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping outside no.91, 8th June
item.description:
A single bag of rubbish in a Tesco shopping bag placed under the tree outside no.91. Remarks: it's NOT from the residents of no.91. I was challenged by people who works in a store along Boundary road when I took this photo, and was asked what's my problem with the rubbish. I believe the answer is very simple - why would I pay my rent to live in a rubbish dumping site? Especially when the rubbish is dumped not according to the rule (outside collection hour, not tied, not in bin bags) hence illegal fly tipping. However, I understand where the aggression came from, I believe the council had reached out to the shops and asked about the fly tipping situation. Apparently this has caused some stress to the store owners and I genuinely hope the council can handle the situation better. As I know the store owner is a law abiding citizen and they has followed the rules alright. And everyone of us has a common goal of making the boundary road better :) peace

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Boundary Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large piece of broken furniture on top floor of Dartford Street building, 8th June
item.description:
Latge piece of broken furniture with broken glass left on top floor of building in Dartford Street near stairwell. Periodically falls over and may damage residents' bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-30, Dartford Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Massive fly tip outside 100 Belgrave Road left since Saturday, 8th June
item.description:
Massive fly tip outside 100 Belgrave Road left since Saturday. Some seems to be builder's waste too! Please can the council use the info (letters and so on) to fine the people who are dumping here. This is a daily problem for residents of 100 Belgrave Road. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parking, 8th June
item.description:
Double yellow lined cycle path. Cars and motorcycles consistently park here while they fill their stomaches up. Unsafe for cyclists and we are always shouted at by drivers. Fix our streets, please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 621,623, Hertford Road, London
